glz_custom_fields

This plugin provides for limitless pimped custom fields within Textpattern. You can also create custom fields as selects, multi-selects, checkboxes, radios and textareas - besides the default text input fields. Predefine values can be set for custom fields and you can select a single default value (selects, multi-selects, checkboxes and radios only).

Time and date pickers

They are pretty straightforward to use, no explanation needed. To set the required JavaScript and styling properly, please refer to the INSTALL file that came with this plugin.

Custom scripts

This is a rather complex and long-sought-of piece of functionality, please refer to the my_image.php file which contains inline explanations on how they should be used. The file came with the plugin, in the scripts/glz_custom_fields folder.

Default values

You can define a single default value by adding curly brackets around a value like this {default value}. Support for multiple values are planned to be implemented at some point.

Ranges

If you want to define ranges, create a new custom field with the following name e.g. Price range &pound;(after)

  • range - this is really important and must be present for the range to work correctly.
  • &pound; - don't use straight symbols (i.e. € or £), instead use entity ones - &pound; & &euro; $ and &cent; are all examples of valid symbols.
  • (after) - don't leave any spaces after e.g. $ and (after). This basically says where to add the measuring unit (be it a currency or something like m3 etc.) - (before) is default.

Ranges are defined 10-20, 21-30 etc. (no measuring units - they get pulled from the custom set name).

Support

If you have lost your glz_custom_fields copy, get another one from glz_custom_fields Google Group. This is a private group, only people that have donated have access to it. I would appreciate if you would post queries on the public Textpattern forum, I want to avoid having to follow two places for support issues. Thanks!

If anything goes wrong or you discover a bug:

  1. Submit it on GitHub. There is also a handy section on glz_custom_fields tips and tricks.
  2. Look for help in the Textpattern forum, glz_custom_fields thread.
  3. Ping me via Twitter. I'm using it around the clock, it's great for short messages!
  4. Drop a line to gerhard@lazu.co.uk (sometimes things can get really hectic on my end, please be patient).
